headline: Local unions group seeks ouster of Kroger CEO after $7.5 billion buyback plan
summary: The UFCW local unions that led the "Stop the Merger coalition" argued that the "abrupt" and "massive" share repurchase program comes at a time when Kroger needs investments in staffing, repairs and store remodels.  Kroger and Albertsons terminated their $25-billion merger plan on Wednesday after a U.S. judge blocked the deal.
